history.content: Quoted from Lydia Raya: "If you are LSCS and graduating after Fall 2017, EE16A is part of your required courses." @1541

children.subject: Hi there, I mentioned this that this would be an exception. You will want to check with the ee 16a faculty this semester to see if you can do this.
Yes, that is exactly my concern. As I talked to advisor this afternoon, I can take 16B in lieu of 16A, but it isn't written on the major requirement page. Hence I posted the question here.

history.content: It seems that ee16a is nearly full and I don't want to take the risk of needing to drop the class just because I am still on waitlist. So I decided to take ee16b instead. Can I use ee16b to replace ee16a requirement for a cs major? (I am graduating in Spring 2018 :( )
history.subject: 16B in lieu of 16A
